reviews.review_msg: Dr Marriott's enthusiasm for Middle Eastern history  is infectious and he varied his lecture format to keep  it interesting.  The quizzes might seem hard at first but keep trying - they are the best prep for the final.  He is very helpful with the research paper, he really wants you to do well.  I would definitely take another course with him.

The teacher does not provide you with any powerpoints or any notes at all, and his teaching comes straight out of "A History of the Modern Middle East" textbook. The tests are tough, so prepare yourself to know exact dates, names, and places on a map. I would not recommend this professor as he literally reads the textbook to you every class.
Seemed kind of pretentious at first, but explained everything really well and had well constructed power points (and he didn't just read from them). Questions encouraged

He is unclear about what to expect from his paper. He also expects u to remember an entire textbook of material for his final and its just way too much to remember for a first year course. He doesn't specify how the tutorial participation works and overall i wouldn't recommend this class. He doesnt seem to be kind with his grading either.
